definitions.text: a base hit on which the batter stops safely at first base
the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number
examples: he has the one but will need a two and three to go with it
the batter singled to left field

definitions.text: being or characteristic of a single thing or person
used of flowers having usually only one row or whorl of petals
examples: single chrysanthemums resemble daisies and may have more than one row of petals

definitions.text: existing alone or consisting of one entity or part or aspect or individual
examples: upon the hill stood a single tower
had but a single thought which was to escape

definitions.text: not married or related to the unmarried state
characteristic of or meant for a single person or thing

examples: a single legal code for all

definitions.text: not divided among or brought to bear on more than one object or objective
examples: judging a contest with a single eye
